_header: How should I but I thought on my ending day
_description: A song of admonition — five 6-line stanzas (aaaabb) and burden: ‘Thynk we on our endyng I red I red I red / Thynk we on our endyng I red or we [gon]’

CamTCC899.First Lines:
How schvld I bot I thogth on my nedyng dayqwen þat I am ded
                    & closyd in clay…
CamTCC899.Last Lines: …ffor warne sche warSwylk on fynd I non
CamTCC899.Editions:
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 252; 1977, 223-.
